back: Experiencing worry, unease, and nervousness; or, earnestly desiring something.
Extremely bad or unpleasant.
To be composed or made up of (used with 'of').
A strong feeling of wanting to have something or wishing for something to happen.
A person keenly wanting to do or have something.
A house and its occupants regarded as a unit.
Determined to do (something); or, the purpose or aim of an action.
All the visible features of an area of land, often considered in terms of their aesthetic appeal.
To raise (something) to a higher position.
A heavy or bulky thing that is being carried or is about to be carried; or, to place a heavy burden in or on (a vehicle or person).
Either of the two saclike organs in the chest that extract oxygen from the air and transfer it to the blood, and that expel carbon dioxide.
The action or process of moving or being moved.
A single step taken when walking or running; or, the speed at which someone or something moves.
Having or showing behavior that is respectful and considerate of other people.
To have as belonging to one; own.
Very quickly; swiftly.
To say something as a comment; or, a comment or observation.
To attempt to find (something); or, to try or attempt (used with 'to').
To give out a bright light; or, a bright light.
To cause (liquid) to flow over the edge of its container.
To take or go with (someone or something) to a place.
A large building or group of buildings fortified against attack with thick walls and battlements.
To give an authoritative order; or, an order or instruction.
To give advice to (someone); or, advice, especially that given formally.
To make certain that (something) shall occur or be the case.
A large-scale, rapid, and violent expansion in volume of a substance or mass, causing a violent shock wave.
Ornaments, such as necklaces, rings, or bracelets, worn by people.
The part of the earth's surface that is not covered by water, as opposed to the sea or the air.
A small body of matter from outer space that enters the earth's atmosphere, becoming incandescent as a result of friction and appearing as a streak of light.
An imaginary creature that is typically large, ugly, and frightening.
Situated in or facing the north.
Situated far from the main centers of population; distant.
Situated in or facing the south.
A carved or cast figure of a person or animal, especially one that is life-size or larger.
Water converted into an invisible gas or vapor by boiling.
To accept or yield to a superior force or to the authority of another person; or, to present (a proposal or application) for consideration or judgment.
A building devoted to the worship of a god or gods.
Situated above another part.
A wild plant growing where it is not wanted and in competition with cultivated plants.
A movable, paired, or single appendage that enables a bird, bat, or insect to fly.
A weapon consisting of a straight, thin stick with a sharp point on one end and feathers on the other, shot from a bow.
A sustained fight between large organized armed forces; or, to fight or struggle against.
A weapon for shooting arrows, typically made of a curved piece of wood or metal and held taut by a string.
Ready to face and endure danger or pain; showing courage.
A leader or ruler of a people or clan; or, most important.
An unfavorable circumstance or condition that reduces the chances of success or effectiveness.
A person who is actively opposed or hostile to someone or something.
An opening, such as a door, passage, or gate, that allows access to a place.
Scarcely; almost not.
To have (a course of action) as one's aim or plan.
The action or sound of laughing.
A part of the trunk or a large branch of a tree that has fallen or been cut off.
Relating to the armed forces or to soldiers, arms, or war.
To comply with the command, direction, or request of (a person or an abstract principle).
Fixed or fastened so as not to give way, become loose, or be lost; or, to fix or attach firmly.
Firmly fixed, supported, or balanced; not shaking or moving.
Firm belief in the reliability, truth, ability, or strength of someone or something.
To turn (something, especially an end or part of something) to form a spiral or coil.
Except if (used to introduce the only circumstance in which something will not happen or be true).
A thing designed or used for inflicting bodily harm or physical damage.
The front surface of a person's body between the neck and the stomach; or, a large, strong box, typically made of wood, used for storage.
The feeling or belief that one can rely on someone or something; firmness of trust; or, a feeling of self-assurance.
A result or effect of an action or condition.
A sudden event, such as an accident or a natural catastrophe, that causes great damage or loss of life.
To interfere with the normal arrangement or functioning of (something); or, to interrupt the sleep, relaxation, or privacy of (someone).
To roughly calculate or judge the value, number, quantity, or extent of; or, an approximate calculation.
High respect; or, to regard with great respect.
To make (someone) feel admiration and respect.
A long-distance running race, typically 26 miles and 385 yards (42.195 kilometers).
Of small width in relation to length; restricted in breadth.
Light in color or having little color; or, (of a person's face) having less color than usual, typically from shock or illness.
Having an uneven or irregular surface; not smooth or level.
To meet the expectations, needs, or desires of (someone).
To give a long, loud, piercing cry or vocal sound; or, a long, loud cry.
Quick to detect or respond to slight changes, signals, or influences; or, having or displaying a quick and delicate appreciation of others' feelings.
Comparative darkness and coolness caused by shelter from direct sunlight.
Something that completes or enhances something else when added to it; or, to add an extra element to (something).
Extreme fear.
A statement of an intention to inflict pain, injury, damage, or other hostile action on someone in retribution for something.
A person harmed, injured, or killed as a result of a crime, accident, or other event or action.
A person, typically one more remote than a grandparent, from whom one is descended.
The space (usually measured in degrees) between two intersecting lines or surfaces at or close to the point where they meet.
A sturdy item of footwear covering the foot and ankle, and sometimes the lower part of the leg.
The edge or boundary of something, or the line separating two countries or regions.
To express one's pleasure to (someone) at that person's success or good fortune.
A rigid structure that surrounds or supports something, such as a picture or a building.
The place where God or the gods live; or, a state of supreme happiness.
Impossible to believe; or, extremely good or impressive.
A traditional story sometimes popularly regarded as historical but unauthenticated; or, an extremely famous or notorious person.
To express approval or admiration of (someone or something).
To begin or continue a course of action.
Not mixed or adulterated with any other substance or material; or, clean and clear.
A person connected by blood or marriage; a family member.
Of or for older or more experienced people; or, a person who is older or holds a higher rank.
Not making or accompanied by any sound.
To descend or drop to the bottom of a sea, lake, or river; or, a fixed basin with a water supply and drain.
Higher in rank, status, or quality.
To enclose or confine on all sides.
Having a relatively large distance between opposite surfaces; or, densely concentrated.
To cover or enclose (something) in paper or soft material.
In or to a foreign country.
A strong feeling of annoyance, displeasure, or hostility.
A woman who is about to get married or has just got married.
Of short duration; or, a set of instructions or an outline of a case.
To pursue in order to catch or catch up with.
To fail to fulfill the hopes or expectations of (someone).
To plunge head first into water.
An act of giving something and receiving something else in return.
An act of kindness beyond what is due or usual; or, to support or prefer.
A payment made to a professional person or to a professional or public body in exchange for advice or services.
For all future time; eternally; or, continually.
A man; or, a rope, chain, or wire attached to something to secure or steady it.
Exquisitely beautiful; or, delightful; very pleasant.
A temporary state of mind or feeling.
The official residence of a sovereign, president, bishop, or other distinguished person.
To officially allow (someone) to do something.
A statement or action expressing disapproval of or objection to something.
The art of making two- or three-dimensional representative or abstract forms, especially by carving stone or wood or by casting metal; or, a work of this art.
A community of people linked by social, economic, religious, or blood ties, with a common culture and dialect.
The period between childhood and adult age; or, a young man.
The underlying support or foundation for an idea, argument, or process; or, the principal constituent of a mixture.
The study of living organisms, divided into many specialized fields.
A structure of bars or wires in which birds or other animals are confined.
A person with whom one works in a profession or business.
A country or area under the full or partial political control of another country and occupied by settlers from that country; or, a group of people or animals living in a particular place.
A formal discussion on a particular topic in which opposing arguments are put forward.
To leave, especially to begin a journey.
To make (someone) feel utterly unhappy or discouraged.
Relating to or based on fact.
To draw the attention of and hold it spellbound.
An important assignment carried out for political, religious, or commercial purposes, typically abroad.
In spite of that; however.
A job or profession; or, the action, state, or period of occupying a place or country.
In or to a foreign country, especially one across the sea.
To induce (someone) to do something through reasoning or argument.
A way or course taken in getting from a starting point to a destination.
The remains of a building, typically an old one, that has suffered much damage or disintegration.
A specialist in a particular branch of study, especially the humanities; a distinguished academic.
Sufficiently great or important to be worthy of attention; noteworthy.
A mountain or hill, typically conical, having a crater or vent through which lava, rock fragments, hot vapor, and gas are being or have been erupted from the earth's crust.
Having a distance larger than usual from side to side; wide.
A short, dense plant with many branches, typically smaller than a tree.
Having the ability, fitness, or quality necessary to do or achieve a specified thing.
To act dishonestly or unfairly in order to gain an advantage.
To focus all one's attention on a particular object or activity.
To arrive at a judgment or opinion by reasoning; or, to bring to an end.
Feeling or showing certainty about something; sure of oneself.
Notably large in size, amount, or extent.
To transport or carry to a place; or, to make (an idea, impression, or feeling) known or understandable to someone.
Clearly stated or decided; not vague or doubtful.
Great pleasure; or, to please (someone) greatly.
The place to which someone or something is going or being sent.
To state or order (something) with authority; or, to say or read aloud (words) to be typed, written down, or recorded.
The outside limit of an object, area, or surface; a border or brink.
A track or way worn by travelers; a line of movement.
A place where people go for holidays or recreation; or, to turn to and adopt (a strategy or course of action), especially a disagreeable or aggressive one, so as to resolve a difficult situation.
A dark area or shape produced by a body coming between rays of light and a surface.
To achieve the desired aim or result.
To believe (something) to be likely or possible; or, a person thought to be guilty of a crime.
A low area of land between hills or mountains, typically with a river or stream flowing through it.
To regard (an object, quality, or person) with respect or warm approval.
Help, assistance, or support (often financial or practical).
To make an effort to achieve or complete (something difficult).
The power or right to give orders, make decisions, and enforce obedience.
The most important city or town of a country or region, usually its seat of government.
To work together toward a common end or purpose.
To resist an attack made on (someone or something); protect from harm or danger.
The action or process of causing so much damage to something that it no longer exists or cannot be repaired.
A state of confusion; or, an illness that disrupts normal physical or mental functions.
The action of separating something into parts; or, a major component of an organization.
To give (someone or something) the authority or means to do something.
To prevent (someone) from progressing, accomplishing, or fulfilling something.
To conduct the policy, actions, and affairs of (a state, organization, or people).
A large or sufficient amount or quantity.
To cause (pain, distress, or anxiety) to become less severe or serious.
The beliefs or opinions that are generally held about someone or something.
Relating to or having the status of a king or queen or a member of their family.
A person who is the legal property of another and is forced to obey them.
To make forceful or violent efforts to get free of restraint or constriction; or, a long, difficult effort or process.
Lacking intelligence or common sense.
A legally recognized subject or national of a state or commonwealth, either native or naturalized.
An advisory, deliberative, or administrative body of people formally constituted and meeting regularly.
To say something in a solemn or emphatic way.
Extremely large.
Very unusual or remarkable.
A thick cloud of tiny water droplets suspended in the atmosphere at or near the earth's surface that obscures or restricts visibility.
A ceremony or service held shortly after a person's death.
An imaginary or mythical being of human form but superhuman size.
An idea, feeling, or opinion about something or someone, especially one formed without conscious thought or on the basis of little evidence.
Money received, especially on a regular basis, for work or through investments.
Mentally ill; insane; or, very angry.
Used to indicate duty or correctness, typically when criticizing someone's actions.
To withstand the action or effect of.
To make (previously unknown or secret information) known to others.
To make free of (a troublesome or undesirable person or thing).
A weapon with a long, sharp metal blade and a handle, used for thrusting or striking.
A story, especially a fictional or imaginative one.
A device or enclosure designed to catch and retain animals, typically by allowing entry but not exit.
A formal examination of evidence by a judge, typically before a jury, in order to decide guilt in a case of criminal or civil proceedings.
Using or involving physical force intended to hurt, damage, or kill someone or something.
The process or fact of entering or being allowed to enter a place or organization; or, a statement acknowledging the truth of something.
The branch of science which deals with celestial objects, space, and the physical universe as a whole.
To feel or state that someone or something is responsible for a fault or wrong.
The branch of science concerned with the substances of which matter is composed, the investigation of their properties and reactions, and the use of such reactions to form new substances.
Without being affected by; in spite of.
A fossil reptile of the Mesozoic era, often reaching an enormous size.
To display (a work of art or item of interest) in a public place or show; or, a public display.
The state of being known or talked about by many people, especially on account of notable achievements.
To predict or estimate (a future event or trend).
Exceptional intellectual or creative power or natural ability.
Having or showing a mild, kind, or tender temperament or character.
The study of the physical features of the earth and its atmosphere, and of human activity as it affects and is affected by these.
To intervene in a situation without invitation or necessity.
With very little weight or force.
First in order of importance; or, the person with the highest authority or most important position in an organization.
A number of people or things in a more or less straight line.
A long, flat piece of wood, metal, or glass attached horizontally to a wall or forming part of a piece of furniture, for storing things.
A desire to annoy, frustrate, or hurt another person.
Excellent; of very high quality.
Covered or saturated with water or another liquid.
To use (something) to a bad effect or for a bad purpose; misuse; or, physical or mental mistreatment.

An edible seed, typically kidney-shaped, growing in long pods on certain leguminous plants.
A cylinder or block of wax or tallow with a central wick which is lit to produce light as it burns.
To change the form, character, or function of something; or, to change one's religious faith or other belief.
A sum of money that is owed or due.
To make or become smaller or fewer in size, amount, intensity, or degree.
Responsibility for an accident or misfortune; or, an imperfection or flaw.
A sum of money saved or made available for a particular purpose.
Showing a readiness to give more of something (especially money) than is necessary or expected.
Any of the foods or substances that are combined to make a particular dish.
To demand something forcefully, not accepting any refusal.
A state of disorder or untidiness.
A solid material that is typically hard, opaque, shiny, and has good electrical and thermal conductivity.
To observe and check the progress or quality of (something) over a period of time; or, an apparatus used to check or observe something.
To disapprove of and attempt to prevent (something, especially a policy or practice).
Accepting or allowing what happens or what others do, without active response or resistance.
The amount or number of a material or immaterial thing, typically measured or expressed in a unit.
To institute legal proceedings against (a person or institution), typically for damages or a breach of contract.
A feeling of worry, nervousness, or unease about something with an uncertain outcome.
An organized military force equipped for fighting on land.
The number equivalent to the product of a thousand millions; 1,000,000,000.
To cut (a hard material) in order to produce an object, design, or inscription.
To seek information or advice from (someone with expertise in a particular area).
A serious, unexpected, and often dangerous situation requiring immediate action.
A large amount of money or assets; wealth; or, chance or luck.
A formal promise or assurance that certain conditions will be fulfilled; or, to provide a formal assurance.
A long walk or walking tour; or, to walk for a long distance, especially over land such as hills or mountains.
Existing or occurring at the beginning; first.
Of extreme force, degree, or strength.
To grant to (someone) the use of (something) on the understanding that it will be returned.
The pointed top of a mountain; or, the point of highest activity, quality, or achievement.
Having or showing the capacity to develop into something in the future; or, unexploited ability.
A feeling of deep pleasure or satisfaction derived from one's own achievements, the achievements of those with whom one is closely associated, or from qualities or possessions widely admired.
Evidence or argument establishing a fact or the truth of a statement.

To turn or cause to turn rapidly round and round.
Extremely small.

Clearly visible or understood; obvious.
Lacking the sense of sight; unable to see.
To determine (the amount or number of something) mathematically.
To talk in a friendly and informal way; or, a friendly, informal conversation.
To perpetrate or carry out (a mistake, crime, or immoral act); or, to pledge or devote (a person or oneself) to a particular course.
To create or constitute (a piece of music or writing); or, to form or make up (a whole).

To use up (resources or reserves) completely; or, to make (someone) feel very tired.
A glass building in which plants are grown that need protection from cold weather.
To refuse to take notice of or acknowledge; disregard.
Easily perceived or understood; clear, self-evident, or apparent.
The branch of science concerned with the nature and properties of matter and energy.
A part of a whole; an amount, section, or piece of something.
To cause (someone) to remember someone or something.
A person employed by an individual or in an office to assist with correspondence, keep records, make appointments, and carry out administrative tasks.
Intensely or extremely bad or serious; or, strict or harsh.
Natural aptitude or skill.
A statement or theory that is put forward as a premise to be maintained or proved; or, a long essay or dissertation written by a candidate for a degree.
Remaining the same in all cases and at all times; unchanging in form or character; or, a distinctive clothing worn by members of the same organization or school.
The faculty or state of being able to see; sight; or, the ability to think about or plan the future with imagination or wisdom.
To take in or soak up (energy, a liquid, or other substance) by chemical or physical action.
A person who is in charge of a worker or organization; a supervisor.
A group of people appointed for a specific function by a larger group and typically consisting of members of that group.
A written or spoken agreement, especially one concerning employment, sales, or tenancy, that is intended to be enforceable by law.
A group of people who work together, especially on and operating a ship, aircraft, or train.
To give all or a large part of one's time or resources to (a person, activity, or cause).
To break up and move earth with a tool or machine, or with hands, in order to make a hole or expose something.
To eat dinner; to have a meal.
To give (money or goods) for a good cause, such as charity.
Consisting of two equal or corresponding parts; or, to increase by adding an equal amount.
To raise or lift (something) to a higher position.
The distinctive taste of a food or drink.
The lowest load-bearing part of a building, typically below ground level; or, an underlying basis or principle.

A part of an object by which it can be carried or controlled; or, to manage (a situation or problem).
A sheet, quantity, or thickness of material, typically one of several, covering a surface or body.
Soft, sticky matter resulting from the mixing of earth and water.
Having an even and regular surface; free from irregularities.
The upper layer of earth in which plants grow, a black or dark brown material typically consisting of a mixture of organic remains, clay, and rock particles.
Being the only one of its kind; unlike anything else.
A large room used for a particular purpose; or, an enclosed space or compartment.
To state that one refuses to admit the truth or existence of (something).
A piece of written, printed, or electronic matter that provides information or evidence or that serves as an official record.
To give special importance or prominence to (something) in speaking or writing.
An abnormally high body temperature, usually accompanied by shivering and headache.
A common infectious viral illness with symptoms including fever, chills, and muscle aches; influenza.
To turn (a liquid) into ice or another solid as a result of extreme cold.
A movement of part of the body, especially a hand or the head, to express an idea or meaning.
To stop the continuous progress of (an activity or process); or, to stop (someone speaking) by saying or doing something.
Coming after all others in order or time; final; or, to continue for a specified period of time.
The state or fact of being similar; resemblance.
In addition to what has been said; besides.
A particular attitude toward or way of regarding something; a point of view.
Based on or in accordance with reason or logic.
To return to a normal state of health, mind, or strength.
To depend on with great trust or confidence.
A sudden upsetting or surprising event or experience; or, to surprise greatly; astound.
Being reserved or having or showing nervousness or timidity in the company of other people.
To look fixedly or intently at someone or something with one's eyes wide open.
As a result or consequence of this; therefore.
To point or direct (a weapon or camera) at a target; or, the purpose or intention of an action.
To join or fasten (something) to something else.
To risk a sum of money or valued item against someone else's on the basis of the outcome of an unpredictable event; or, an act of betting.
A four-wheeled vehicle pulled by two or more horses, historically used for passengers.
Judged over a period of time to be of the highest quality and outstanding of its kind.
To travel some distance between one's home and place of work on a regular basis.
To establish the truth or correctness of (something previously stated, suspected, or feared).
To indicate the faults of (someone or something) in a disapproving way.
To be different or distinct from each other; or, to disagree.
The cost incurred in or required for something; the money spent on something.
Done in accordance with rules of convention or etiquette; suitable for an official or serious occasion.
The measurement of how tall a person or thing is, or how high a place is above the ground.
To create or design (something that has not existed before); or, to make up (a story or excuse).
Of or denoting a lower rank or status; or, a person of lower rank or status.
Work, especially hard physical work; or, a task or stage of work.
A skilled worker who repairs and maintains motor vehicles and other machinery.
Of first importance; main; or, the period in a person's life when they are strongest or most successful.
To move or cause to move from one place to another, especially over a small distance; or, a period of time worked by an employee.
A gesture, sound, or action that is used to convey information or an instruction.
Free from pretense or deceit; proceeding from genuine feelings.
Possession of the means or skill to do something.
The science or practice of farming, including cultivation of the soil for the growing of crops and the rearing of animals to provide food, wool, and other products.
A humorous drawing or sequence of drawings in a newspaper or magazine; or, a motion picture using animation.
The upper interior surface of a room or other similar compartment.
To cause (someone) to believe firmly in the truth of something.
Eager to know or learn something.
To make (someone or something) late or slow; or, a period of time by which something is late or postponed.
A book in which one keeps a daily record of events and experiences.
A part or aspect of something, especially one that is essential or characteristic; or, a substance that cannot be chemically interconverted or broken down into simpler substances.
Complete trust or confidence in someone or something; or, strong belief in God or the doctrines of a religion.
A small, hard seed, especially one of a cereal plant such as wheat, corn, or rice.
To address (someone) with kind words or gestures on arrival or on meeting.
To carry out a systematic or formal inquiry to discover and examine the facts of (an incident, allegation, etc.) in order to establish the truth.
A feeling of great pleasure and happiness.
A small piece of paper, fabric, plastic, or similar material attached to an object and giving information about it; or, to attach a label to (something).
A member of a religious community of men typically living under vows of poverty, chastity, and obedience.
Different from what is usual or expected; strange.
A temporary stop in action or speech; or, to interrupt action or speech briefly.
An ordained minister of the Catholic, Orthodox, or Anglican Church having the authority to perform certain rites and administer certain sacraments.
A paid occupation, especially one that involves prolonged training and a formal qualification.
To legally take (another's child) and bring it up as one's own; or, to choose to take up or follow (an idea or course of action).
To ask (someone) earnestly or humbly for something.
At or to the farther side of; further on than.
A set of clothes worn by an actor or by a participant in a masquerade or other disguise.
To cry out suddenly in surprise, anger, or excitement.
To stretch out or lengthen (one's body or part of one's body); or, to increase the area or scope of.
A person who acts unwisely or imprudently; or, to trick or deceive (someone).
To refuse to allow (something).
To provide (a book, newspaper, etc.) with pictures; or, to explain or make clear by using examples or graphics.
Used to emphasize a statement or response confirming something already suggested.
To explain the meaning of (information, words, or actions); or, to translate orally or into sign language.
In a kind manner; or, used in polite requests.
A reason for doing something.
A structure or place made or chosen by a bird for laying eggs and sheltering its young; or, a cozy dwelling or retreat.
The point or manner in which something arises or is derived.
The action or process of receiving something sent, given, or inflicted; or, a formal social gathering.
To dismiss as inadequate, unacceptable, or faulty.
Complete absence of sound.
A small, narrow river; or, to move in a steady flow.
The general character or attitude of a place, piece of writing, situation, etc.; or, the quality of a sound.
To achieve or complete successfully.
To officially agree to or accept as satisfactory.
Close to the actual, but not precisely accurate or exact.
A fence or other obstacle that prevents movement or access.
To discover or determine the existence or presence of (something not easily apparent).
A moral or legal obligation; a responsibility.
Relating to the basic, simplest, or fundamental parts of a subject.
An act or instance of failing to achieve something expected or desired.
Taking place or progressing slowly or by degrees.
A person who comes to live permanently in a foreign country.
To place, fit, or thrust (something) into another thing.
Happening or coming immediately.
The state of being extremely poor.
To behave as if something is true when one knows it is not.
A position in a hierarchy; or, to give (someone or something) a grade or rank.
The action or process of recognizing or being recognized, especially formal acknowledgment.
To subject (food or drink) to cold in order to chill or preserve it.
A tenant's regular payment to a landlord for the use of property or land; or, to take or use (something) in return for payment.
To leave one's job and cease to work, typically upon reaching a certain age.
A piece of data obtained from a study of a large quantity of numerical data.
A person who is trained to travel in a spacecraft.
Not asleep.
The ability to do something that frightens one; bravery.
To rest on top of a liquid or in the air without sinking; or, to move gently through the air.
To agree to give or allow (something requested) to; or, an amount of money given for a particular purpose.
The force that attracts a body toward the center of the earth, or toward any other physical body having mass.
A precious stone, typically a brilliant-cut diamond or other gemstone.
A person who works in a mine.
A naturally occurring, inorganic substance, such as salt, gold, or stone, found in the earth.
To take part in an action or endeavor.
The action of officially allowing someone to do a particular thing; consent.
To flow rapidly in a steady stream; or, to transfer (a liquid) from one container to another.
The state or fact of existing, occurring, or being present.
(Of food) not cooked; or, (of material) in its natural state; not yet processed or refined.
An artificial body placed in orbit around the earth or another planet in order to collect information or for communication.
A set of markings at regular intervals for measuring; or, the relative size or extent of something.
To move by stepping lightly and quickly, alternating feet; or, to intentionally miss out (something).
To extend or spread one's limbs or body; or, to extend over a distance or an area.
An optical instrument designed to make distant objects appear nearer, containing an arrangement of lenses or curved mirrors.
Beneath the surface of the ground.
An anxious awareness of danger; fear; or, a warning sound or device.
Separated by a distance; at a specified distance from each other.
To seize (someone) by legal authority and take them into custody.
A prize or other mark of recognition given in honor of an achievement; or, to grant (a prize or payment) to someone.
To mate and then produce offspring; or, a stock of animals or plants within a species having a distinctive appearance and typically having been developed by deliberate selection.
A roughly cylindrical open container, typically of metal or plastic, with a handle, used to carry liquids or solids.
An event in which people compete for superiority in a sport, area of knowledge, or skill.
To declare (someone) to be guilty of a criminal offense by the verdict of a jury or the decision of a judge.
A building for housing a motor vehicle or vehicles.
A person who writes for newspapers, magazines, or news websites or prepares news to be broadcast.
